common.metaDescription: Andal Network is infrastructure for rental buildings that improves tenant engagement, delivers embedded benefits, and increases retention. Our network connects residents to local merchants, services, and benefits while giving landlords the tools to improve retention and NOI.

home.description: Earn points by uploading receipts and redeem them for cash

hero.headline: Turn Your Rent Payments Into Rewards
hero.subheadline: Register as a tenant, upload your rent receipts, provide feedback, and earn money for timely payments and valuable insights.

receiptUpload.description: Simply upload your rent receipts with our intuitive interface. Quick, secure, and hassle-free.

onTimePayments.title: On-Time Payment Bonus
onTimePayments.description: Get extra rewards when you pay your rent on time. Consistent payments mean more points in your account.

feedbackRewards.title: Earn for Feedback
feedbackRewards.description: Share your experience and get rewarded. Your feedback helps improve services and earns you points.

affiliatedMerchants.title: Affiliated Merchants
affiliatedMerchants.description: We are building partnerships with everyday merchants. Soon you'll be able to redeem your points for rewards at these locations.

homeownership.title: Path to Homeownership
homeownership.description: Turning rent into a path towards homeownership.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.subtitle: Start earning rewards in just a few simple steps

step1.title: Register
step1.description: Create your account as a tenant. It only takes a few minutes to get started.

step2.title: Upload Receipts
step2.description: Upload your rent receipts through our secure platform. We'll verify and process them quickly.

step3.title: Pay On Time
step3.description: Make timely rent payments to earn bonus rewards. Consistency pays off with extra points.

step4.title: Provide Feedback
step4.description: Share your feedback about your rental experience and earn additional rewards for your insights.

step5.title: Redeem Rewards
step5.description: Convert your points to cash. Redeem your points whenever you're ready.

testimonials.title: What Our Tenants Say
testimonials.subtitle: Join thousands of satisfied tenants earning rewards

testimonial1.name: Sarah Johnson
testimonial1.text: I've earned over $200 in cash just by uploading my receipts and paying on time. It's so easy!

testimonial2.name: Michael Chen
testimonial2.text: The feedback rewards are a great incentive. I love that my opinions matter and I get rewarded for sharing them.

testimonial3.name: Emily Rodriguez
testimonial3.text: Best part is I can convert my points to cash. This platform has made rent payments rewarding!

cta.title: Ready to Start Earning?
cta.description: Join thousands of tenants who are already turning their rent payments into rewards.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Everything you need to know about Andal

payThroughAndal.question: Do I pay my rent through Andal?
payThroughAndal.answer:
No. You continue paying rent directly to your landlord exactly as you do today, whether that's e-transfer, bank transfer, cheque, or any other method.

Andal does not process rent payments, does not hold tenant funds, and does not sit between you and your landlord.

whyProof.question: Then why do you ask for proof of rent payment?
whyProof.answer:
Proof of payment is used only after you've already paid your landlord directly.

We use it to:
• Confirm you paid on time (so we can award rewards)
• Track participation in our early access program
• Test whether positive incentives improve tenant experience

Think of it like submitting a receipt to earn cash back: we're verifying an action that already happened, not processing the payment itself.

whatProof.question: What kind of proof do you need?
whatProof.answer:
Simple, non-invasive proof such as:
• Screenshot of an e-transfer confirmation
• Bank transaction confirmation showing the payment
• Receipt from your landlord (if they provide one)

We do NOT ask for:
• Full bank statements
• Account passwords
• Sensitive financial data

You control what you share. Most tenants send a quick screenshot that shows the date, amount, and recipient — nothing more.

handleMoney.question: Does Andal handle my money?
handleMoney.answer:
No.

Andal:
• Does not touch your rent money
• Does not move money between you and your landlord
• Does not act as a payment processor
• Never holds tenant funds

All rent payments happen directly between you and your landlord, outside our platform.

landlordSees.question: What does my landlord actually see?
landlordSees.answer:
Landlords see high-level, aggregate information only, such as:
• "This tenant paid on time this month" (yes/no confirmation)
• General trends across all tenants (e.g., "85% of tenants paid on time")
• Anonymous feedback themes (e.g., "Maintenance response time is a concern")

Your landlord does NOT see:
• Individual payment proofs
• Personal financial details
• Specific feedback you submit (it's anonymized)
• Your personal data

whatData.question: What data does Andal collect?
whatData.answer:
We collect only what's necessary:
• Contact information (name, email, phone)
• Unit/property information (for rewards delivery)
• Payment confirmation (timing, not details)
• Your feedback

We do NOT collect:
• Bank account numbers or passwords
• Credit card information
• Full financial statements
• Browsing history or device data

sellData.question: Do you sell my data?
sellData.answer:
No. Never.

Andal:
• Does not sell individual tenant data to third parties
• Does not share your information with marketers
• Uses data solely to operate the rewards program and improve tenant-landlord communication

affectLease.question: Can this affect my lease or rent?
affectLease.answer:
No.

Participating (or not participating) does NOT:
• Change your lease terms
• Affect your rent amount
• Impact your standing as a tenant
• Give landlords grounds to penalize you

stopParticipating.question: Can I stop participating at any time?
stopParticipating.answer:
Yes.

You can:
• Stop uploading payment proofs
• Stop answering surveys
• Delete your account

No penalties.

Any rewards you've already earned remain yours. You simply stop earning new rewards going forward.

missMonth.question: What if I miss uploading proof one month?
missMonth.answer:
No problem.

Missing one month means you won't earn rewards for that month, but:
• You can resume the next month
• No penalties or negative consequences
• Your account remains active

This is a rewards program, not a requirement.

finishedProduct.question: Is this a finished product?
finishedProduct.answer:
No, this is an early access pilot.

We're testing whether rewards and better communication can:
• Improve tenant experience
• Reduce unnecessary moves
• Help landlords address concerns earlier

What this means for you:
• The system is simple and limited during testing
• We're actively listening to feedback
• Features may change based on what works
• You're helping us build something better for tenants.

Your participation and feedback shape the final product.

issuesConcerns.question: What if I have issues or concerns?
issuesConcerns.answer:
We're here to help.

Contact us at:
• Email: test@domain.com
• Phone: +1(438)5253145
• Support hours: Usually within 24-72 hours

costToJoin.question: Is there a cost to join?
costToJoin.answer:
No. Andal is 100% free for tenants.

Your landlord pays for the service. You just earn rewards.

landlordNotUsing.question: What if my landlord doesn't use Andal yet?
landlordNotUsing.answer:
Currently, Andal is available only to tenants whose landlords have signed up for the program.

Want your landlord to offer this?
Forward them to our website or email us at test@domain.com and we'll reach out to them.

landlords.title: We Help Landlords Win Whether Tenants Stay or Leave
landlords.subtitle: Andal Network is infrastructure for rental buildings that improves tenant engagement, delivers embedded benefits, and increases retention. Our network connects residents to local merchants, services, and benefits while giving landlords the tools to improve retention and NOI.

keepTenants.title: Scenario 1: Keep Good Tenants Longer
keepTenants.description: Engage tenants monthly and predict churn before it happens

monthlyEngagement.title: Monthly Engagement
monthlyEngagement.description: Monthly engagement through rewards for on-time rent + quick surveys

churnPrediction.title: Churn Prediction
churnPrediction.description: 90-day early warnings with churn risk scores

interventionTools.title: Intervention Tools
interventionTools.description: Dashboard alerts show at-risk tenants. Root cause analysis with sentiment tracking and pattern detection.

smoothExits.description: Reward early notice and enable zero-vacancy transitions

earlyNotice.title: Early Notice Rewards
earlyNotice.description: Reward early notice (for 60-day notice instead of 30-day)

smoothExit.title: Smooth Exit Program
smoothExit.description: Rewards for clean unit, allowing showings, timely key return

reputationManagement.title: Scenario 3: Reputation Management
reputationManagement.description: Build your reputation through authentic reviews and private feedback channels

happyTenants.title: Route Happy Tenants
happyTenants.description: Automatically invite satisfied tenants to leave reviews on Google, Yelp, and apartment review sites

privateFeedback.description: Provide a private channel for tenants to share concerns directly with property management - address issues before they become public

result.title: Result

high.title: High Risk
high.description: Average satisfaction below 50%. Recent surveys show low satisfaction levels.
high.method: Risk assessment uses exponential decay weighting to prioritize recent surveys and detects declining trends.

medium.title: Medium Risk
medium.description: Average satisfaction between 50-70%. Moderate satisfaction with potential concerns.
medium.method: Risk assessment uses exponential decay weighting to prioritize recent surveys and detects declining trends.

low.title: Low Risk
low.description: Average satisfaction above 70%. High satisfaction levels indicate low risk.
low.method: Risk assessment uses exponential decay weighting to prioritize recent surveys and detects declining trends.
